newsitem.title: HONG KONG: New HK leader may miss British sunset party - paper.
newsitem.headline: New HK leader may miss British sunset party - paper.

text.p: Hong Kong's future leader Tung Chee-hwa may have to miss Britain's farewell party in order to greet Chinese leaders arriving hours before the territory reverts to China, a newspaper said on Saturday.
Britain is hosting an elaborate sunset party before it hands Hong Kong back to China at a midnight June 30 ceremony.
The South China Morning Post said Tung aides had pencilled the event on his diary but his attendance would hinge on when China's President Jiang Zemin and Premier Li Peng arrive in Hong Kong.
"We have him slotted in for doing that...if he isn't obliged to be somewhere else," an aide said.
"He can't be in two places at once. In the end he will go to the one that matters to Hong Kong."
Details of the arrival of Chinese officials are shrouded in mystery, although one newspaper report has said Jiang and Li will come in by boat in order to evade pro-democracy protesters.
Britain's Prince Charles will formally hand Hong Kong back to Jiang at midnight June 30 in front of more than 4,000 VIPS, in a ceremony beamed live to a worldwide audience.
